title: How to Make Vegan French Tomato Tart

steps.headline: Make your own preferred shortcrust pastry.
steps.description: Wholemeal is suggested but not necessary.

steps.headline: Roll out pastry and place it in a pre-oiled flan tin.
steps.description: Place it in the fridge for 1/2 an hour to chill.

steps.headline: Place thinly sliced tomatoes, garlic, herbs and 3 tbsp olive oil into a frying pan or paella dish and fry over medium heat for 5 minutes.
Turn the tomatoes and add the sugar and pepper.
steps.description: Reduce heat and cook for 5 - 8 minutes.

steps.headline: Take the tomatoes off the heat.
Set up a colander or criss-crossed cookie rack over the sink and carefully lift out the tomatoes (one by one if necessary) so that they do not break.
steps.description: Lay on the colander or rack to cool and drain. You are trying to remove as much moisture as possible. See below for ideas of what to do with the leftover juice mix.

steps.headline: Remove the pastry case from the fridge and pierce base with fork.
steps.description: Blind bake for 10 minutes in oven (400ºF/200ºC). (See below for blind baking instructions.)

steps.headline: Remove from oven, allow to cool for 1 - 2 minutes and take out the foil and beans.
Arrange the tomatoes individually in the pie crust.
steps.description: You can make a spiral arrangement or simply lay them in there, overlapping wherever they will. Drizzle with the remaining olive oil - add more if desired. You can also add dried herbs if desired at this stage or add fresh garnishes after cooking.

steps.headline: Serve with fresh basil strewn across the pie or drizzle additional olive oil.
steps.description: Absolutely delicious warm, straight out of the oven. And still tasty cold, as long as it has been stored in an airtight container and consumed same day of baking.

text: Assemble ingredients.  Make your own preferred shortcrust pastry. Wholemeal is suggested but not necessary. Roll out pastry and place it in a pre-oiled flan tin. Place it in the fridge for 1/2 an hour to chill. Place thinly sliced tomatoes, garlic, herbs and 3 tbsp olive oil into a frying pan or paella dish and fry over medium heat for 5 minutes.  Turn the tomatoes and add the sugar and pepper. Reduce heat and cook for 5 - 8 minutes. Take the tomatoes off the heat.  Set up a colander or criss-crossed cookie rack over the sink and carefully lift out the tomatoes (one by one if necessary) so that they do not break. Lay on the colander or rack to cool and drain. You are trying to remove as much moisture as possible. See below for ideas of what to do with the leftover juice mix. Remove the pastry case from the fridge and pierce base with fork. Blind bake for 10 minutes in oven (400ºF/200ºC). (See below for blind baking instructions.) Remove from oven, allow to cool for 1 - 2 minutes and take out the foil and beans.  Arrange the tomatoes individually in the pie crust. You can make a spiral arrangement or simply lay them in there, overlapping wherever they will. Drizzle with the remaining olive oil - add more if desired. You can also add dried herbs if desired at this stage or add fresh garnishes after cooking. Bake for 15 - 20 minutes (400ºF/200ºC).  Serve with fresh basil strewn across the pie or drizzle additional olive oil. Absolutely delicious warm, straight out of the oven. And still tasty cold, as long as it has been stored in an airtight container and consumed same day of baking. Finished.
